page.title: 07CLUBS- COUSLAND PLAYGROUP
page.content: THE PLAYGROUP IN COUSLAND VILLAGE HAS BEEN RUNNING FOR 10 YEARS,MEETING EACH TUESDAY,WEDNESDAY AND THURSDAY FROM 9.30-12NOON AND GIVING 3-5 YEAR OLDS MORNINGS OF FUN, GAMES AND THE CHANCE TO PLAY TOGETHER.15 CHILDREN ATTEND THIS YEAR,BUT THERE IS ROOM FOR 20. THE CHILDREN PLAY WITH TOYS,DO JIGSAWS MAKE THINGS FROM SCRAP MATERIAL,PLAY WITH SAND AND WATER.THE SIMPLE TOYS ARE USUALLY THE BEST,WITH THE CHUTE AND BIG TRANSPORT TOYS AS FAVOURITES. VISITS ARE OFTEN MADE TO A NEARBY COUNTRY PARK,FARMS TRAMPOLINES AND MUSEUMS. FIVE CHILDREN ARE LEAVING PLAYGROUP TO START SCHOOL IN 1985. IT COSTS ABOUT Â£1360 TO RUN THE PLAY- GROUP EACH YEAR.THIS IS RAISED FROM COFFEE MORNINGS,GALA DAY STALLS, SPONSORS AND NATIONAL GRANTS.
